intro: Scleria androgyna, commonly known as the African flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets arranged in a dense, cylindrical cluster, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Scleria androgyna is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
